definitions.definition: Postpartum depression
The trachea.
Any duct for air or other gas.
A section of road or bridleway which has a reputation for having strong crosswinds or localized wind swirls.
The anus.

A discipline in freestyle skiing and snowboarding, involving sliding down a large launch ramp and then launching off a big kicker, to obtain height and time in the air to perform acrobatic maneuvers, and land on a landing slope.
Any material used to cover the top layer of soil to protect, insulate, or decorate it, or to discourage weeds or retain moisture.
definitions.example: An organic mulch is a mulch made of natural substances such as leaves or grass clippings.

definitions.definition: A material used as mulch, as a decorative redwood bark mulch.
To apply mulch.
definitions.example: Mulch your vegetable garden to retain moisture and keep weeds down.

definitions.definition: To turn into mulch.
definitions.example: I decided to mulch the grass clippings.

definitions.definition: A commissioned officer in an armed military organization, typically the highest rank before flag officer ranks (generals). It is generally found in armies, air forces or naval infantry (marines).
To act as or like a colonel.
A period of quiet, rest and relaxation, especially after a party etc.
A genre of house music and ambient music with an ethereal sound and a driving beat.
Something that is twisty, such as a road
A strand of hair twisted together in a braid-like fashion
Characterised by a twist, or that which twists.
definitions.example: lost in a twisty labyrinth

definitions.definition: Curly
A person who is interned, forcibly or voluntarily.
To imprison somebody, usually without trial.
definitions.example: The US government interned thousands of Japanese-Americans during World War II.

definitions.definition: To internalize.
Internal.
A student or recent graduate who works in order to gain experience in their chosen field
A medical student or recent graduate working in a hospital as a final part of medical training
To work as an intern. Usually with little or no pay or other legal prerogatives of employment, for the purpose of furthering a program of education.
definitions.example: I'll be interning at Universal Studios this summer.

definitions.definition: The moment at the end of a performance when actors come back on the stage and thank the audience for applauding them for their performance.
A section of a written work containing citations, not quotations, to all the books referred to in the work.
A list of books or documents relevant to a particular subject or author.
The study of the history of books in terms of their classification, printing and publication.
Somebody or something that appears in the final stage of a competition.
A university student in his/her final year of study.
A rotational motion, especially that given to a ball, in which the upper surface spins in the direction of motion.
definitions.example: The tennis star was famed for her topspin.

definitions.definition: An edgy, quirky or otherwise engaging quality that holds the interest of the audience.
To spin (a ball) with this motion.
Short private road that leads to a house or garage.
A virtual sexual encounter in which two or more persons connected remotely via a computer network send one another sexually explicit messages simulating a sexual experience.
To exchange explicit sexual experiences online via text or multimedia.
To engage in sexual activity, usually masturbation, while communicating online with another person.
Any of various birds of the suborder Alcedines (or the family Alcedinidae sensu lato), having a large head, short tail and brilliant colouration; they feed mostly on fish.

A type of lever used to propel a boat, having a flat blade at one end and a handle at the other, and pivoted in a rowlock atop the gunwale, whereby a rower seated in the boat and pulling the handle can pass the blade through the water by repeated strokes against the water's resistance, thus moving the boat .
An oarsman; a rower.
definitions.example: He is a good oar.

definitions.definition: An oar-like swimming organ of various invertebrates.
To row; to travel with, or as if with, oars.
A pleasant smell; the scent, odor, or odoriferous particles emitted from a sweet-smelling substance; a pleasant odor
A substance created to provide a pleasant smell or one which emits an agreeable odor.
To apply perfume to; to fill or impregnate with a perfume; to scent.
An especially close and trusted friend.
An object or concept considered very useful or helpful.
A font that is dark, having a high ratio of ink to white space, written or drawn with thick strong lines.
A male partner in an unmarried romantic relationship.
A male friend.
Without sympathy, feeling or compassion; callous or heartless
The reappearance of an item or enemy; the situation where something is respawned.
To spawn again.
(of a collected item, weapon or other pickup, or enemy) To reappear at its spawn point.
(of a character) To re-enter play after being killed.
A place, as in clothing, which has been repaired by mending.
The act of repairing.
definitions.example: My trousers have a big rip in them and need a mend.

definitions.definition: To repair, as anything that is torn, broken, defaced, decayed, or the like; to restore from partial decay, injury, or defacement.
definitions.example: My trousers have a big rip in them and need mending.

definitions.definition: To alter for the better; to set right; to reform; hence, to quicken; as, to mend one's manners or pace.
definitions.example: Her stutter was mended by a speech therapist.

definitions.definition: To help, to advance, to further; to add to.
To grow better; to advance to a better state; to become improved.
The space, often unfinished and with sloped walls, directly below the roof in the uppermost part of a house or other building, generally used for storage or habitation.
definitions.example: We went up to the attic to look for the boxes containing our childhood keepsakes.

definitions.definition: A form of alternative medicine involving the diagnosis of body ailments through the examination of the iris of the human eye.
The female equivalent of a churchman.
A state of disunion.
To upset the composure of.
To bring into confusion.
To frustrate, discomfit.
definitions.example: The emperor disconcerted the plans of his enemy.

definitions.definition: Characteristic of a burden; arduous or demanding
A brush used in hair care for brushing, tidying, and detangling hair
The characteristic lowing sound made by cattle.
A foolish woman.
definitions.example: You silly moo! What did you do that for?

definitions.definition: Of a cow or bull, to make its characteristic lowing sound.
The characteristic sound made by a cow or bull.
To leave the company of.
To cut hair with a parting; shed.
To divide in two.
definitions.example: to part the curtains

definitions.definition: To be divided in two or separated; shed.
definitions.example: A rope parts.  His hair parts in the middle.

definitions.definition: To divide up; to share.
To have a part or share; to partake.
To separate or disunite; to remove from contact or contiguity; to sunder.
To hold apart; to stand or intervene between.
To separate by a process of extraction, elimination, or secretion.
definitions.example: to part gold from silver

definitions.definition: To leave; to quit.
To leave (an IRC channel).
The act of parting or dividing; the state of being parted; division; separation.
A farewell, the act of departing politely.
The dividing line formed by combing the hair in different directions; part (US)
(founding) The surface of the sand of one section of a mould where it meets that of another section.
The separation and determination of alloys; especially, the separation, as by acids, of gold from silver in the assay button.
A joint or fissure, as in a coal seam.
The breaking, as of a cable, by violence.
Lamellar separation in a crystallized mineral, due to some other cause than cleavage, as to the presence of twinning lamellae.
(of an illness) Transmitted from one person to another, usually through the air breathed.
definitions.example: Cancer is not infectious.

definitions.definition: (of a person) Able to infect others.
definitions.example: Despite feeling better, the patient is still infectious.

definitions.definition: (of feelings and behaviour) Spreading quickly from one person to another.
definitions.example: Her enthusiasm for work can be really infectious.

definitions.definition: Memorable and invoking excitement or interest.
definitions.example: Pop music is more infectious than elevator music.

definitions.definition: Fear or hatred of Islam or Muslims.
A highly addictive phenethylamine stimulant drug, similar to cocaine. Its systematic (IUPAC) name is (S)-N-methyl-1-phenylpropan-2-amine.
A wise person or spiritual teacher; someone of gravity and wisdom, especially, a teacher venerable for years, and of sound judgment and prudence; a grave or stoic philosopher.
Wise.
Grave; serious; solemn
The plant Salvia officinalis and savory spice produced from it; also planted for ornamental purposes.
Any plant in the genus Salvia
Any of a number of plants such as sagebrush considered to be similar to Salvia officinalis, mostly because they are small shrubs and have gray foliage or are aromatic.
The act of using the word or option sage in the email field or a checkbox of an imageboard when posting a reply.
definitions.example: Reminder to sage and report.

definitions.definition: Word used in the email field of imageboards to prevent a bump of the post. Used as an option rather than a word in some imageboard software.
definitions.example: sage in all fields

definitions.definition: A cemetery or graveyard.
(of a telephone call) Such that the caller is only connected and charged if the person he specified is available to speak.
(of a loan) Such that the lender and borrower are individuals rather than companies.
A negatively charged ion.
A branch of linguistics studying the meaning of words.
definitions.example: Semantics is a foundation of lexicography.

definitions.definition: The study of the relationship between words and their meanings.
The individual meanings of words, as opposed to the overall meaning of a passage.
definitions.example: The semantics of a single preposition is a dissertation in itself.

definitions.definition: The meaning of computer language constructs, in contrast to their form or syntax.
definitions.example: file sharing and locking semantics

definitions.definition: A polygon with seven sides and seven angles.
The side of the road, along which a kerb runs.
A Good Samaritan
Notes in the margin of a document.
definitions.example: We know what the composer was thinking as he wrote the piece because we can read his handwritten marginalia on the manuscript.

definitions.definition: A mechanical, electrical, or hydraulic system used to guide a vehicle without assistance from a human being.
definitions.example: I set the autopilot to due south, so I could get some rest.

definitions.definition: (by extension) A state of mind where one no longer thinks about doing one's actions, but acts mechanically
definitions.example: I've been doing this 12 hours non-stop, and am so hungry and tired that I've stopped thinking: I'm now on autopilot.

definitions.definition: (of a vehicle) To pilot itself; to drive or travel automatically.
A certain sport, similar to squash, but played with a bigger ball.
A ball used for this sport.
In certain sports, as in tennis or long jump, a fault in which the athlete's foot is in the wrong place at the wrong time.
definitions.example: In tennis, a foot fault results when server's foot is placed outside the service area prior to the ball being hit.

definitions.definition: To lessen in price or estimated value; to lower the worth of.
To decline in value over time.
To belittle or disparage.
An illegal act of sexual intercourse by an adult with a person under the legal age of consent for sex, or with another adult who is not able to consent because of intellectual disability.
Of or characteristic of sisters.
In the manner of a sister, behaving as one would expect of a sister; as a sister, as sisters.
An underground railway.
A train that runs on such an underground railway.
An urban rapid transit light railway
A train that runs on such a railway.
A metropolitan area
Metropolitan
A twist or fold.
Any of the folds on the surface of the brain.
The shape of something rotating; a vortex.
State or condition of being convoluted.
A form of moving average.
A function which maps a tuple of sequences into a sequence of tuples.
One 360° turn in a spring or similar helix. A keyring contains 2 convolutions.
The high-pitched sound of a small object moving rapidly through air.
Energy; vigor; vim.
A zip fastener.
Zero; nothing.
definitions.example: I know zip about economics.

definitions.definition: A trip on a zipline.
A zip file.
An ounce of marijuana.
To close with a zip fastener.
To close as if with a zip fastener.
definitions.example: zip one's lip

definitions.definition: To compress (one or more computer files) into a single and often smaller file, especially one in the ZIP format.
To subject to the convolution mapping function.
(followed by a preposition) To move rapidly (in a specified direction or to a specified place) with a high-pitched sound.
definitions.example: The bullet zipped through the air.

definitions.definition: (followed by a preposition) To move in haste (in a specified direction or to a specified place).
definitions.example: Zip down to the shops for some milk.

definitions.definition: To make (something) move quickly
To travel on a zipline.
Zero; nothing.
definitions.example: I know zip about economics.

definitions.definition: Imitative of high-pitched sound of a small object moving rapidly through air.
A ZIP code; a US postal code.
(by extension) Any postal code, for any country.
Not containing substances (such as CFCs) that that are destructive to the ozone layer
A beam of sunlight; a sunbeam
A beam of artificial light, especially one rich in ultraviolet
A plant, Enceliopsis nudicaulis, that has a broad, yellow flowerhead
Resembling a mouse.
Abounding or infested with mice.
The nerve-dense, retractable fold of skin which covers and protects the head of the penis in humans and some other animals.
definitions.example: The female clitoral hood is homologous with the foreskin.

definitions.definition: To remove the foreskin
To sexually stimulate by manipulating the foreskin.
The act or process of inferring by deduction or induction.
That which is inferred; a truth or proposition drawn from another which is admitted or supposed to be true; a conclusion; a deduction.
To read (something) as though letter by letter; to peruse slowly or with effort.
(sometimes with “out”) To write or say the letters that form a word or part of a word.
To be able to write or say the letters that form words.
definitions.example: I find it difficult to spell because I'm dyslexic.

definitions.definition: Of letters: to compose (a word).
definitions.example: The letters “a”, “n” and “d” spell “and”.

definitions.definition: (with “out”) To clarify; to explain in detail.
definitions.example: Please spell it out for me.

definitions.definition: To indicate that (some event) will occur.
definitions.example: This spells trouble.

definitions.definition: To constitute; to measure.
To speak, to declaim.
To tell; to relate; to teach.
To work in place of (someone).
definitions.example: to spell the helmsman

definitions.definition: To rest (someone or something), to give someone or something a rest or break.
definitions.example: They spelled the horses and rested in the shade of some trees near a brook.

definitions.definition: To rest from work for a time.
A grain, considered either a subspecies of wheat, Triticum aestivum subsp. spelta, or a separate species Triticum spelta or Triticum dicoccon.
A thin piece of wood or metal; a splinter.
Spelter.
To split; to break; to spalt.
A man-made landing place for ships on a shore or river bank.
The bank of a river, or the shore of the sea.
To secure by a wharf.
To place on a wharf.
One who publishes, especially books.
A black-and-white chequered flag which signifies the end of a race.
A victory in a race.
To become lank.
Slender or thin; not well filled out; not plump; shrunken; lean.
Meagre, paltry, scant in quantity.
(of hair) Straight and flat; thin and limp. (Often associated with being greasy.)
Languid; drooping, slack.
Any of various small sharks
The bowfin, Amia calva.
A private chapel or prayer room.
A large Roman Catholic church.
The art of public speaking, especially in a formal, expressive, or forceful manner.
Eloquence; the quality of artistry and persuasiveness in speech or writing.

The function of compiling and providing financial information primarily by reports referred to as financial statements, including bookkeeping, systems design, analysis and interpretation of accounting information.
A company or organisation that performs such a function.
A substance that induces an immune response, usually foreign.
A market for the trading of company stock.
A cattle market.
To make legal or permit under law. Either by decriminalising something that has been illegal or by specifically permitting it.
definitions.example: There is a debate whether or not to legalise some of the softer drugs.

definitions.definition: A small person.
A small fish, especially a stickleback.
A plant related to the thistle with enlarged flower heads eaten as a vegetable while immature, Cynara cardunculus var. scolymus.
A dull green colour, like that of an artichoke.
A Stalinist idealization of the dictatorship of the proletariat applied to art that used realistic techniques to show the struggle for socialism in a positive and optimistic manner.
A large room used for dancing and banquets.
A type of elegant dance.
To take part in ballroom dancing.
A harsh, discordant combination of sounds.
Conflicting notes that are not overtones of the note or chord sounding.
A state of disagreement or conflict.
A small dried grape, usually the Black Corinth grape, rarely more than 4mm diameter when dried.
The fruit of various shrubs of the genus Ribes, white, black or red.
A shrub bearing such fruit.
The portion of the playing area where one can legally play the ball, puck, etc.
The side of a vehicle on which the driver primarily propels it.
Not in an offside position; In the part of the playing area where one can legally play the ball, puck, etc.
definitions.example: The goal was allowed because the attacker was onside.

definitions.definition: On the side of a vehicle from which the driver, paddler, etc. propels it.
Favourably located, from the point of view of the player taking a finesse.
In agreement or support; on board.
A building, often found on a farm, used for storage or keeping animals such as cattle.
A unit of surface area equal to 10−28 square metres.
An arena.
definitions.example: Maple Leaf Gardens was a grand old barn.

definitions.definition: To lay up in a barn.
A child.
A concave plate of brass or bronze that produces a sharp, ringing sound when struck: played either in pairs, by striking them together, or singly by striking with a drumstick or the like.
Any of several large terrestrial birds of the family Otididae that inhabit dry open country and steppes in the Old World.
A light, brief snowfall.
A sudden and brief blast or gust; a light, temporary breeze.
definitions.example: a flurry of wind

definitions.definition: A shower of dust, leaves etc. brought on by a sudden gust of wind.
Any sudden activity; a stir.
definitions.example: The day before the wedding was a flurry of preparations.

definitions.definition: A snack consisting of soft ice cream mixed with small pieces of fruit, cookie crumbs, etc.
The violent spasms of a dying whale.
An occurrence of something (countable instances) in large numbers, happening suddenly or in a short period of time.
definitions.example: The fencer landed a flurry of hits on her opponent.

definitions.definition: To agitate, bewilder, fluster.
To move or fall in a flurry.
One of an old breed of powerful, deep-chested, and smooth-coated dogs, used chiefly as watchdogs and guard dogs.
Lutheran Book of Worship (hymnal)
An instance of a batsman being out due to the leg before wicket law.
An act of intercepting something, the state of being intercepted, or a thing that is intercepted.
A passing play where the ball is received by the opposing team.
A pass that is intercepted by an opposing player.
Performing with industrious concentration; hard-working and focused.
definitions.example: Scientists are very diligent in their work.
